entry.content:
Since the enableFriendlierSafeBrowsingSettings flag is expected to be

enabled and deprecated, regular tests should default to it being enabled

rather than disabled so that cleanup is more straightforward.



This CL removes the enableFriendlierSafeBrowsingSettings disabling

override for the 'SafeBrowsing' suite, fixes the resulting failing test,

and adds a flag-off version of that test in the FlagsDisabled suite.

entry.title: wallpaper: observe WallpaperDailyRefreshScheduler
entry.content:
Implement the logic of checking and refreshing daily wallpaper by

observing OnCheckpointChanged() notified by the new scheduler. The

scheduler provides 2 signals daily, which means there's another retry

if the first one somehow fails. This is gated by the

wallpaper-refresh-revamp flag.



The old refresh timer is still kept but will not run once the feature

flag above is enabled.



BUG=b:290627996

TEST=ash_unittests -gtest_filter="WallpaperControllerTest.*"

entry.title: Revert "webview(metrics): Fix host package information in SDK runtime"
entry.content:
This reverts commit b98c18ec53e4840458a8e8d06b38550bff73da35.



Reason for revert: breaks Webview Sandbox CTS. The blamelist on the first failing CI run was bisected and this came back as the culprit.



Please confirm locally that the Webview Sandbox CTS passes before relanding.



Original change's description:

> webview(metrics): Fix host package information in SDK runtime

>

> The context we retrieve for the SDK runtime is a generic

> sdksandbox context. This results in our metrics and minidumps

> reporting a generic package name that won't help

> for investigating issues.

>

> The good news is that the uid for the SDK sandbox

> process does belong to the host app and there is a deterministic

> relationship between the SDK process and the host app

> so we can get the host apps information from it.

>

> The one tricky bit is that this trick doesn't apply to the

> render process because it is an isolated process and so

> doesn't have this same relationship.

> We settled on feeding this through as a command line

> switch.

>

> I unfortunately haven't added tests because we don't

> have any instrumentation tests for the SDK runtime

> and this behavior is wildly environment specific.

> I just tested it manually with a shell app that contains

> a WebView and also confirmed that the mini dumps show

> correctly in the dev UI when I induce a crash with

> chrome://crash. I have also tested this against staging

> crashpad and confirmed that the crashes show up there.

>

> Low-Coverage-Reason: We don't have Rb infrastructure for tests

> Bug: 1464923

> Change-Id: Ifa063299caeed57679d99febe90b2e95cbb09ee8

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4720129

> Commit-Queue: Rupert Wiser

> Reviewed-by: Alexander Timin

> Reviewed-by: Richard Coles

> Reviewed-by: Luc Nguyen

entry.title: Add JPEG bpp (bits per pixel) histograms
entry.content:
Add a family of 23 Blink.DecodedImage.JpegDensity.Count.* histograms to

record the bits-per-pixel values of JPEG images for various image sizes

(where size is the area = width * height).



- 9 histograms for image sizes 0.1 MP ~ 0.9 MP, in increments of 0.1 MP

- 13 histograms for image sizes 1 MP - 13 MP, in increments of 1 MP

- 1 histogram for image sizes > 13 MP



To avoid recording outliers in these histograms, only color (not

grayscale) images are recorded in these histograms.



The histograms are updated when the images are successfully decoded.



Bug: 1456182

Change-Id: I0711392b3bd1da5f7d7dcaf93a0f3b78b1300586

entry.title: Enabled Leipzig Migration by default
entry.content:
This CL enables the feature by default and removes the field

trial config.



On top, this CL addresses a small bug in the test logic which

only surfaces for account profiles: The ClearAllLocalData()

function in the PDM is used to reset all previously imported

profiles. However, account profiles are not considered local

in the database. As a result, they are loaded again after

clearing which breaks the test.



The test is fixed by not relying on clearing but to explicitly

test for the existence of both profiles.



Change-Id: I2fcc912d11b95045a293dab8037b144f33a470e9

Bug: 1475277, 1423319

entry.title: Shortcuts: Add ShortcutCustomizationAllowed policy
entry.content:
* This CL adds the ShortcutCustomizationAllowed admin policy.

* Add |accelerator_prefs|, it will be get initialized by shell and used

to register the boolean.

* In the following CLs, we will use this policy to control

ash::prefs::kShortcutCustomizationAllowed, then use the pref to

allow/disallow customization of key shortcuts. We will also add an

observer to support dynamic refresh (without needing to restart

Chrome).

entry.content:

1. Move AdvertisementClient and subclasses into

standalone files.

subclasses.

|watch_advertisements_pending_clients| in WebBluetoothServiceImpl.

4. Rename `FakeBatteryObjectBundle` as `FakeBluetoothDeviceBundle`

and extend it to be reused for multiple fake bluetooth devices.

5. Add tests for watchAdvertisements.

entry.title: [mac-a11y]: fixes crash for text retrieval change
entry.content:
In

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4794012



we changed the call to

AXAttributedStringForTextMarkerRange:markerRange



to limit the size of text retrieved.



However, the code continues to call

addTextAnnotationsIn:to



which walks the range, querying for the text markers, and adds the

annotations. This unfortunately assumes the caller wanted the entire

range which is no longer true.



Correct this by breaking out of the loop if we go beyond the length of

the attributed string.



R=aleventhal@chromium.org



Fixed: 1475049, 1465923

Change-Id: Ia4329d3a095ef6274e93e706bedff7621e463705

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4804804

entry.title: PreloadingDevTools: Force-enable prefetch when CDP client is connected
entry.content:
Prerender already has the similar mechanism [1], but prefetch hasn't

had. This CL adds the mechanism: Preloading technologies tries to

preload pages. If a holdback feature flag is enabled or holdback field

is true in PreloadingConfig, the preloading attempt is not actually

done. In daily use of Chrome, this behavior is OK, but this is not for

web developers when they are debugging Speculaiton Rules and

preloading. So, we disables this disabling mechanism when CDP clients

are connected.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/117.0.5935.1:content/browser/preloading/prerender/prerender_host_registry.cc;l=656-660



Bug: 1470620, 1410709

entry.content:

sheriffed on the main waterfalls. So, this CL changes things so

that cr23_browser_tests, cr23_interactive_ui_tests, and cr23_views_unittests

entry.title: [Autofill] Introduce an alternative field type dependent form signature.
entry.content:
If a website changes form or field names on every page load, a web form

has a random form signature each page load. Thus, the server cannot

accumulate enough votes for a given form signature to infer a meaningful

prediction and we say that the web form has unstable form signature. A

new form signature which depends on field types and non-empty url parts

only is more stable/generic.



Bug: b/296872098

entry.title: [PA] Add a feature flag that controls straightening of slot span free lists
entry.content:
Straightening free lists is quick, but it isn't clear if it helps reduce

fragmentation or gets in the way. Needs to be properly evaluated.



Note that if we don't straighten, we still have to walk the list to

remove the truncated entries.



Keep the feature enabled by default, to match the existing behavior.

entry.title: [Sync] Implement encryption of outgoing password sharing invitations
entry.content:
The ecnryption is happening in the model type worker because both data

types are not encrypted like other data types and use their own

encryption. ModelTypeWorker was chosen because it contains cryptographer

and will implement a corresponding decryption code.



Note that the encryption does not actually work yet (see integration

tests), they will be fixed in follow-up CLs.

entry.title: [iOS] Make bottom sheets observe WebStateList
entry.content:
These two classes implement the observer protocol, but don't actually

register themselves as observers of the WebStateList. That means when

the WebStateList is destroyed, webStateListDestroyed isn't actually

invoked, and so the cleanup never happens. This is causing crashes.



This CL corrects the issue, and adds a test which replicated the crash

(and no longer crashes with the fix).

entry.title: ash: Fix public user sign-in crash
entry.content:
Public user sign-in sets wallpaper under `UserLoggedIn`. This triggers

`DeskController` to check `IsSessionRestoreInProgress`, which assumes

the user profile is loaded. It is not the case for the public user

sign-in. This CL fixes the crash by making `DeskController` check

`IsSessionRestoreInProgress` when it has a valid `current_account_id_`.

`current_account_id_` is only set when the corresponding user has

finished sign-in.

entry.title: [Android][Settings] Record usage of autofill options entry point
entry.content:
To check the usage (and in the future compare it with different places),

add a referrer parameter when launching the AutofillOptions screen.



The main entry point is the settings surface and the bucket count

will serve as a regression metric for different locations.

Other planned entry points are:

- deep links (i.e. a link from another App to this setting)

- links from messages (to fix inconsistency device & browser setting)

- potentially entry points from fallback surfaces



The deep link bucket is added but not recorded to satisfy the

argument checks in recording which would crash otherwise.

entry.title: [Eche] Create mojo interface and bindings for keyboard layout changes
entry.content:
This introduces a mojo interface that allows the EcheSWA to request the

current keyboard layout configuration and creates an observer interface

to route the information back. Additionally, EcheKeyboardLayoutHandler

also observes ImeControllerImpl and sends the same information to the

SWA whenever the keyboard layout changes.

entry.title: [iOS] Manage sign-in promo with feed top section coordinator
entry.content:
Previously, the feed top section would only exist if the signin promo

was visible. We want to eventually be able to add other content to the

top section, so the feed top section should always exist and be

responsible for managing the visibility of the signin promo.



Now, the FeedTopSectionCoordinator is always created and it decides

whether the promo mediator should be created based on flags and

auth status.



Fixed: 1470857

entry.title: Fix bookmark codec with shopping collection
entry.content:
This patch removes a check that is guaranteed to fail in the bookmark

codec if the shopping collection exists. The checks in this block

assume that the node will not be in the model during the decode

process which is not the case for the shopping collection. That

specific code path is intended for permanent nodes.

entry.title: xvfb.py: Use same screen size for Weston as for xvfb
entry.content:
We currently start Weston with `--width=1024 --height=768`, but run xvfb

with dimensions 1280x800. There doesn't seem to be a good reason why

Weston should use a different screen size.



Additionally, some TabDragging tests don't pass on Weston with the

current, smaller screen size. These tests are currently all disabled

when running under Weston, but making them pass is currently being

worked on. This CL moves us one step closer towards enabling the tests.

entry.title: ozone/wayland: Reset state before calling observer.OnWindowRemoved()
entry.content:
WaylandWindowManager::RemoveWindow() shouldn't notify observers before

resetting `pointer_focused_window_` and `keyboard_focused_window_`,

because they might call GetCurrent{Pointer,Keyboard}FocusedWindow(),

which return the wrong window if the removed window had pointer/keyboard

focus (or hit a DCHECK, if enabled).



This has been observed when running interactive_ui_tests'

DetachToBrowserTabDragControllerTest.DeleteTabsWhileDetached test.



Bug: 1474921

entry.title: [SHv2] Split up update tasks in a background and UI task
entry.content:
This CL changes the functionality of the Safety Hub service that allows

splitting up the update task in one for the background thread (where

the most expensive computations can take place), and one on the UI

thread. The former will be a static function to ensure that it is

thread-safe. The unused site permissions service is updated using this

new structure accordingly.

entry.content:
While most unit tests will not have an AutofillDownloadManager, some

may - in particular those involving an AutofillClient. This change lets

them disable server communication in those tests.

entry.title: Resolve url('') to an empty-non-null KURL
entry.content:
Null KURLs are problematic in that they are not hashable - and not

expected by a lot of code. Thus returning a KURL that will be backed by

an empty but non-null String will be more robust.



Revert the special-casing from StyleImageCache since it should now no

longer expect to get null KURLs.

entry.title: bindings: Add some validation rules for ObservableArray<T>
entry.content:
- Observable arrays cannot be used as constants or operation arguments

- Observable arrays cannot be used in static attributes

- Certain types cannot be used as an observable array's element type



While here, derive web_idl.ObservableArray's debug info from its

corresponding ObservableArrayType, otherwise

ForbiddenObservableArrayElementTypes cannot provide a location when it

fails.

entry.title: [iOS] Set button delegate before configure buttons
entry.content:
When the edit button is created in `configureEditButtons` from

`TabGridToolbarsMediator` private functions, it takes into account the

button delegate which should call the correct functions. If the

delegate is set after, the edit button might be configured with the bad

delegate.

entry.title: CCA: Don't update layout when window is minimizing/minimized
entry.content:
If the update() in layout is called while the app is

minimizing/minimized, the width and height of the video will be zero,

which causes NaN when calculating the new viewport/content size.



This CL simply drops the update if the size of video is invalid.

entry.title: [Tracing] Connect to producer host before binding the SHM arbiter
entry.content:
Binding the shared memory arbiter can result in mojo calls to the

producer host which result in crashes if the producer hasn't been

connected yet.



This CL makes sure the producer is connected before the arbiter is

bound.
